title: Beadwork Panel, 1696
medium:
Medium: beads, linen
Technique: beads strung according to pattern on linen cord one row at a time, then anchored with red silk around the cord and between each row
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Three panels originally made as sides for a beadwork box. The box would have needed several other panels and would have had an irregular shape. Panel B is a rectangle with heart's ease (pansies) facing sideways.

tombstone.epitaph:
Beadwork Panel, 1696.
1696. Medium: beads, linen
Technique: beads strung according to pattern on linen cord one row at a time, then anchored with red silk around the cord and between each row. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-58-25-b.
